alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 3:23PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Caribou, Oneida, southeastern Bannock, northwestern Franklin and northwestern Bear Lake Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 321 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lava Hot Springs to 11 miles west of Snowville. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, penny size hail and brief heavy downpours. Ponding of water is possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Soda Springs, Malad, Lava Hot Springs, Swanlake, Grace, Downey, Arimo, Pleasantview, Cherry Creek Rest Area, Holbrook Summit, Thatcher, Virginia, Clifton, Oxford, Stone, Samaria, Daniels Reservoir, Holbrook, Niter and Malad Pass. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region
